main event: Three round red objects were seen in Marietta, GA, on January 10, 1958.
interesting points: The objects were described as two or three times the size of a star,The sighting lasted three minutes,The reporting officer concluded that the sighted objects were likely a weather balloon,The objects appeared in a line and were visible during night hours,Weather balloon launchings were normally scheduled around the time of the observation.
witness description: Ground visual observation by a reporting officer
